text: is a Japanese airport in Osaka.Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, and Transport (MLIT), Kansai International Airport. Retrieved 20 January 2012. It is an international airport for the region. The airport is in three different cities because of where it is built. The airport is on an artificial island in Osaka Bay, southwest of Ōsaka Station. It opened 4 September 1994, and the gross area is 1,068ha. This airport has two runways. One is 3500m×60m, and the other is 4000×60m. In 2011, the total number of passengers was 13,651,184 (9,902,449 were international and 3,748,735 were domestic), and of landing was 53,899 (38,252 were international and 15,647 were domestic). == Related pages == * List of airports in Japan == References == == Other websites == * Kansai International Airport, operations ; http://www.kansai-airport.or.jp/index.asp * Kansai International Airport, corporate * http://www.kald.co.jp/english/eindexframe.html Category:Airports in Japan Category:Osaka Prefecture
title: Kansai International Airport
